How do You Determine the Height to Cut My Lawn?

The height at which we cut your lawn is determined by a range of factors, the most common of which is the time of year. In the spring, we'll start mowing your lawn at a lower height. In order to combat the sun, your grass should be cut higher as the temperatures rise. We mow your lawn very high during the hot summer months to keep it as lush and green as possible.As the weather cools in the fall, we'll gradually start cutting the lawn a little shorter each week. Please contact our office if you would like your lawn cut higher or lower at any time, and we will do our best to cut your lawn to the height you want. This can be more difficult for bi-weekly cuts at certain times of the year.

How Often do you bill? How do I pay?

We bill your account immediately after a service is completed, as per our service agreement. The balance is then automatically charged to your saved credit card the next business day. Both major credit and debit cards are accepted, and we do need a credit card on file for service. As a result, we can provide the best service at the best price.

What Happens If Damage is caused to my property?

Please contact our office as soon as possible. Please notify us immediately if you notice any possible harm that might have been caused by our mowing crews. We have contractors and team members on standby to deal with these issues as soon as possible. Please do not contact a third-party repair company until contacting us.

Does someone need to be home when you mow?

When the lawn is mowed, no one needs to be around. We simply need access to all grassy areas on your land.

Do you offer landscape design or planting?

Yes, we do offer landscaping services. To schedule an appointment, please contact our office. One of our team members will assess your needs and provide you with a personalized, competitive proposal.

Why do sprinkler heads get damaged?

It is very common for lawn equipment to damage sprinkler heads. Irrigation systems, like most other systems on your house, require routine maintenance. When the ground shifts and pushes the heads into a more hazardous location than when they were originally mounted, and when the spring-loaded sprinkler head wears out, these are the two most common causes of irrigation damage.Both of these issues are common in even the most pristine landscapes. Don't panic if your sprinkler head has broken! Simply mark the broken head with everything from an irrigation flag to a chopstick, call our office, and we'll come out right away to patch it. This does not need you to be at home.

Why do you mow when my lawn is wet?

As a professional lawn care service our clients expect us to keep their grass mowed on schedule. This generally requires us making good judgment calls on when to mow. During the months when your lawn is actively growing, it is preferable for us to come out and mow the lawn wet rather than skipping the lawn and risking it going weeks without a hack. Ruts can happen at any time.It's possible that ruts could form in your lawn if it's wet when you mow it. Almost all of these ruts are just temporary and will disappear as the lawn dries out. If your lawn becomes too wet to mow on your scheduled day, please contact us immediately and we will gladly pause your operation.We do our utmost to make the best choice for our clients, but due to the subjectivity of this type of scenario, doing it right every time for each client's needs can be difficult.

How normal is fence damage?

Fence damage is a common occurrence. A lot of fences aren't built with lawn mowing in mind. If your fence has pickets with grass going along them instead of some kind of runner it is very common for trimmer line from the weed eater to create a line and eventual divot in the fence pickets that gets worse over time.A board on board fence makes this even more likely if there is not a runner at the bottom of the fence. The most popular source of damage is gates. If you ever have a question about your fence or suspect harm, please contact our office as soon as possible, and we will send someone out to assess the situation and schedule any necessary repairs.

How do the mowers move so fast?

We use top-of-the-line commercial lawn mowers. These are the best mowers you can find, and they usually cost 2-3 times as much as an average mower. These mowers are self-propelled and designed to drive much quicker than a traditional walk-behind mower. The most important thing is to make sure the blades are nice and clean. That is why we replace the blade with a new sharp one every day. This isn't a normal occurrence.

What if I am not happy with my service?

All of our services are guaranteed. If you are dissatisfied with a service performed on your property, please contact us as soon as possible. Depending on the situation, we will: 1. dispatch a supervisor to investigate and resolve the issue. 2. Have the crew return to repair the issue. 3. Schedule a meeting with a supervisor to discuss the issue. 4. Fix the problem during the next scheduled visit. 5. Arrange for a supervisor to meet with the crew at your property to resolve the issue.
